page.title: 19Transport - Eastchurch
page.content: In common with other parts on the Isle of Sheppey this area has suffered a reduction in the bus service and the loss of a{rail {service. The Sheppey Light Railway opened in 1901 providing a service from Queenborough to Leysdown with halts at Brambledown and Eastchurch within this block. It was a single line track giving a restricted service until road transport improved resulting in its closure in 1950. Part of the site of the railway can still be seen at Sheppey Light Farm and the wooden shelter from Brambledown Halt can now be seen at the cricket club in Eastchurch Village. An infrequent{bus service and{transport}by car now provide the only means of{travel.
